page.title: 09William Rufus
page.content: William Rufus was the second son of William the Conquerer.He was known as William Rufus because he had red hair.William Rufus became king in 1087.He was not a very good king because he made bad laws and went hunting a lot.He was out hunting in the New Forest one day,when an arrow struck him and he was killed straight away.People think he was killed by Sir Walter Tyrell,but do not know if it was murder or an accident.There is a legend his body was taken to Winchester on a cart by a man called Purkis.A stone was set up in the New Forest where he died and is known today as the Rufus Stone. The Rufus Stone is a popular tourist attraction nowadays.
